summary.p1: My passion is creating electronics and software that tackles tough problems. I have experience spanning hardware, firmware and software design, making me a flexible engineer and a valuable resource on small teams.
summary.p2: I am seeking an exciting company in Bristol where I can continue to design software systems and make an impact with my unique skillset. My primary goals are to continue to learn, have fun and write elegant code.

education.thesis: Modular Power System Design for BRRISON
education.honors: Magna Cum Laude, Engineering Honors Program

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.summary: Currently leading the development of Cascadence, a cloud-based analytics platform which provides machine learning solutions for real-time industrial datasets.
points: Leading the design of a React-based application with rich data visualization and real-time analysis results.
Collaborating with the data science team to engineer AWS-based tools for importing, processing and drawing results from large datasets.
Designed a backend which parses time series data from various sources and collates them in a SQL database with a Flask REST API.
Previously consulted for several mobile communication and IoT apps using Angular, Vue, Nativescript, Ionic and Toucan.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.summary: Developed web apps and database structures for the Hospital Billing application of Epic’s electronic medical record software.
points: Transitioned a core billing app to Epic’s .NET web framework, fully rewriting the data model and back-end logic in C#.
Reimagined the VB front-end using ASP.NET and Javascript, improving aesthetics and adding asynchronous loading.
Managed hierarchical database objects and used the Caché scripting language to write load and save APIs.
Pioneered scrum and SVN processes for a new agile dev cycle.

jobs.title: Research Engineer - Software and Electronics
jobs.summary: Engaged in the end-to-end design of industrial prototypes, building proofs-of-concept by modeling systems, designing electrical PCBs and writing firmware to control them.
points: Implemented a 32-bit AVR running C for sensing, actuator control, USB comm and an LED-based UI for truck drivers.
Created a PCB to condition automotive power, read analog engine sensors and drive a motor and valves in response.
Wrote firmware for several test units which gathered and streamed data using either USB or Bluetooth.
Processed and analyzed test data using Python and NumPy.

jobs.company: Southwest Research Institute and University of Colorado
jobs.title: System Design Lead and Electrical Engineer
jobs.summary: Led the engineering team for DayStar, a sub-arcsecond star tracking system which was implemented and flown on NASA's $1.5M BRRISON balloon mission.
points: Built a spectral performance model in MATLAB which drove the architecture of the optics, video processing and custom CMOS camera PCB.
Created a PCB stack to power an ATX motherboard, two scientific cameras, the steering mirror, mechanisms and heaters.
Wrote firmware to manage system power, handle ATX power timing and accept commands from the PC over a USB interface.
Analyzed flight test video using NumPy to prove star finding capability and calculate subarcsecond tracking accuracy.
